channel.title: [fR2] A much better use of HDRI images for C4D
channel.description:
Just so you guys know, this is for final-Render Stage 2 for Cinema 4D. However if you're smart enough you can also use this for the standard Advanced Render. fR2 just has a MUCH better GI algorithm, which produces better results and much faster. So with that said, lets go ahead.
This is good if you have a very simple scene, you prefer it, you suck at normal lighting, you're compositing something onto a backgroung, etc.
You have a crap scene like this. [img]http://img50.imageshack.us/img50/7480/untitledla5.png[/img] So you toss in a light. Still isn't too grand. [img]http://img409.imageshack.us/img409/3883/untitled1ii2.png[/img] [b]HDRI![/b] Here's what we'll do. Make a new material and take off all channels but Luminance. In that channel, open up a HDRI you have. Turn the effect to Multiply, and make the Luminance 100 and the HDRI a lower number, usually a number that changes the brightest white to something you can see. This will take some playing around with.
Make a sky object, and put that material on the sky.
Now, open the Render Settings, and goto Options and turn off AutoLight. In Effects > finalRender Stage 2, goto Global Illumination and turn it on. You shoulddd be set =] [img]http://img409.imageshack.us/img409/2997/untitled2qf6.png[/img]
